Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2017 09:38AM dearrainy wrote: thank you all. i do appreciate it. i will update if i ever find anything out.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2017 09:13AM - edited Aug 5, 2017 09:21AM by dearrainy wren: i'm sorry, i probably wasn't very clear in my original post (like i said, i've been having a lot of problems with concentration and memory lately). they said it was a 7mm growth on the parotid lymph node. i searched for info on this but couldn't find anything online. i know that's really small. i don't think my doctor is concerned about breast cancer at all. she just threw out the option of getting my armpit biopsied because i was complaining about the pain and that it's not going away, and that we are no closer to finding an answer to why i am having all of these symptoms. she seems to want to take a 'wait and see' approach, even though it's been two months and things are getting progressively worse. i told her about the pain in my shoulder and she said i probably slept on it wrong. i told her about the breast itchiness and she just looked at my boobs quickly was like 'huh'. the pain in my armpit and shoulder today is so bad, it's almost unbearable. as to the allergy question, i have bought a new bra, tried several other bras that i own that i have never had a problem with, gone braless... all to no avail. nothing seems to have any effect. i would try something like benadryl, but i take topamax for headaches, and the two cannot be mixed. i looked up internists in my area after melissa's suggestion and if the biopsy doesn't show anything, then i suppose i will probably go down that road. i'm not sure what they can test that hasn't already been tested, but it's worth a try.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2017 11:22AM dearrainy wrote: bevin: i usually get the reports online through our local health system. i don't know why i haven't gotten this one yet. they usually come through a day or two after things have been done. maybe because it was abnormal? i did ask to be put on the cancellation list. the doctor originally said he was referring me and they would call to schedule, but they never did, so i called them. unfortunately, since i have to go to the people my insurance covers, they're the only game in town. i don't particularly like this practice because i think they tend to treat people like crap and it takes forever to get in, but they are the experts at what they do. however, i love the hospital system they are part of and think they provide top level care. as for a mammogram, i've never had one. i'm 32. i called and left a message for my hematologist (who's subspecialty is oncology) to see if he is able to do a biopsy of my armpit because the pain in my shoulder has been so intense for the last two days. it's moving into my back now too. strangely, since the pain in my shoulder started, my breast hasn't really been itchy. if they don't find anything in my lymph node, i will probably heed your advice about the mammogram. better to be safe than sorry. thanks for the advice.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2017 04:34AM dearrainy wrote: just a quick update... i have been seen by tons of doctors and had tons of tests done. tested for autoimmune disorder, lyme disease, hiv, blood clots, chest ct, colonoscopy, vestibular dysfunction - all came back clear. they cannot find any reason for my symptoms. so this week, they are FINALLY going to do a mammogram and ultrasound of a very swollen lymph node in my armpit. i'm starting to suspect lymphoma over breast cancer, but i'm not a doctor. hopefully, by the end of the week, i will have some answers to what the heck has been going on.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2017 05:04AM dearrainy wrote: if it isn't cancer, then i (and i think my doctors too) am/are out of ideas... my only other thought is that it could be something in my blood, since it is affecting so many different parts of my body (memory and concentration, dizziness, stomach, digestive system, lymph nodes, skin, hair, breathing, blood - i am now anemic, low fever, etc etc.) i have no idea what that could possibly be, but with infection and inflammation ruled out, if the lymph nodes in my armpit and face don't yield anything, then that is literally my last thought.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2017 06:21AM dearrainy wrote: kbeee: thanks for your post. things are worse again this morning... bad shortness of breath, dizziness, severe itching all over, pain in both armpits. i called my doctor's office and asked if there was anything they could do to move up the mammogram and ultrasound. they are going to call me back. i don't want to go back to the hospital, because i know they will just do the same tests and then tell me it's either stress or 'all in my head' as they have so many times before. my ex even called me the other day "to check on me" and when i told him things were getting worse and they are checking for cancer this week, he told me to 'let it go' and that it was psychosomatic. not a great guy, hence why we are no longer together. i think that, even worse than the symptoms, is the fact that people don't believe you when they can't find something wrong right away. so discouraging. i really hope they can pull some strings and get the ultrasound done today. i don't know what else to do at this point. how are your friends doing?
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2017 04:46PM dearrainy wrote: crazybc: i haven't read anything online about hair loss, but i am finding tons on my floor. i had c diff for about 6 months straight a few years ago, and that was the only other time i've experienced hair loss like this. i had to cut it short because i lost so much. i agree, i think it is just from strain on the body from being sick for a long time. maybe even malnutrition. i checked my weight this afternoon and i'm down 11 pounds in about a month and a half. (i'm definitely not angry about losing weight... i've been trying for years and literally nothing has worked, but i know this is not healthy weight loss.) is your itching all over or one specific area? mine was just the chest for months, and then went away for a week or two, and now it is arms, legs, groin, and chest. it's driving me crazy. my thyroid has been tested multiple times too and is perfectly in the middle of the range. my whole endocrine system was tested and is totally fine. please let me know what you find out! my test was pushed back til tomorrow am. just a little bit longer to wait. ugh. just trying to distract with movies. what else is there to do?
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2017 08:26AM dearrainy wrote: I saw a vestibular specialist for the dizziness... they specialize in disorders of the head/brain and balance issues. they did an MRI of my head with and without contrast, which is how they found the mass in my parotid lymph node. i know my symptoms are very atypical. i have read some articles online saying that breast itchiness, pain in the lymph nodes and shoulders can all be signs. but maybe they aren't in this case. i guess i should also add that i had a breast reduction about 5 years ago where my nipples were reattached, so (i assume) it is highly unlikely that i would have any symptoms with my nipples, since they don't work. (not that i am arguing with you... just looking for info one way or another. i watched doctors tell my mother she was fine for 10 years before they finally figured out she actually had MS.) thank you for the response!
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2017 09:33AM dearrainy wrote: so this morning has been totally insane. i got a phone call while i was getting ready this morning, and i knew it was from someone in my healthcare system, but no message was left, so i just went ahead to my appointment. when i got there, they told me they had called to tell me the ultrasound machine was down and they couldn't do the test, and had left a message. i had a complete breakdown. they were super nice and were able to get me a new appointment two hours from now at a different location. the one lady even gave me her phone number in case i need to talk... she has a daughter my age she said, and gave me a hug before i left. then i got some food and did a reset. as i was driving home, i was thinking about how my neck has been hurting for the past few days, but it doesn't seem to be muscular, because it doesn't seem to make a difference whether i move it. just like my shoulder. so i started wondering if there might be another lymph node there, pressing on a nerve. i started feeling around, and when i got kinda near my windpipe, i hit paydirt. small lump, that when pushed, sent a shooting pain clear through to my spine. again, on my right side, where all the other nodes are. it can't be coincidence, right? so i'm more concerned than ever. but at the same time, i keep seesawing back and forth between thinking they're going to find something major and this will be another test where they won't find anything. it's exhausting. i apologize for posting so much. i just don't really have anyone else to talk to about this.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2017 03:31AM dearrainy wrote: hi all, just wanted to give you an update: i FINALLY got an answer to what has been going on, and it is literally the stupidest thing. after the other day when the ultrasound showed nothing, i was very down. i had an appointment for the neurologist yesterday, but i wondered if i was just wasting my time. i decided to go anyway, just in case. i am so glad i did. i told the neurologist everything that had been going on. he knew what it was immediately. topamax. he said i was basically reading off a list of side effects. i asked how that was possible, as i've been on it for probably close to a decade now, and he said the body can just basically develop intolerances over time. he looked at my recent bloodwork and said that confirmed it. there were two numbers... CO2 and chloride which have been off for a while, which everyone has been explaining away as from diarrhea, but he said it's actually from having trouble breathing, and it's a telltale sign of the problem. it was right under their noses the whole time. i felt like skipping out of his office. i have to wean off the drug, so i'll probably still feel shitty for a while, but still. today, i looked up the side effects, and there are TONS. but all of mine were there. why i got the ones that mimicked a serious disease, i will never know. just my body playing a fun joke, i guess. anyway, i thought you guys would get a kick out of the answer to the riddle. it was all from two little pills. amazing.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2017 04:11AM dearrainy wrote: djmammo: yeah, that is not a listed side effect. i have that appointment 1 month from today. but i am not too concerned about it anymore, now that pretty much everything else can be explained. i'm guessing it will just be some benign growth, but we will have to wait to see. thanks!
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2017 09:20AM - edited Aug 5, 2017 09:21AM by dearrainy djmammo: i don't have a copy. usually i get them online, but for some reason, it hasn't shown up yet. the doctor called me and told me that it was a 7mm growth 'most likely' on the lymph node. and yes, he didn't tell me that he was referring me to an oncologist, but i looked up the doctor, and his specialty is oncology. i did do a search on the parotid gland after that and symptoms of a tumor there, and none of the symptoms matched up. so i don't think it is that, unless it is something like lymphoma, which would show in my blood tests i believe. it's such a confusing mess. at this point, maybe an oncologist IS the best person to see. i don't know.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2017 08:04AM dearrainy wrote: outfield: thank you for this post. the phyician that found this and the physician i am going to see are all part of a group of otolaryngologists... his subspecialty is in oncology. that's why i have to wait for such a long time, i think, to see someone... because of the specialty. this does give me some comfort, though, while i have to wait. perhaps it is just a coincidence and not related to all of the other things going on. i have decided to keep a journal of my symptoms each day in hopes that maybe that will help them figure something out... i don't really know what else to do at this point.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: dearrainy wrote: Hi there. I am waiting to get a biopsy done. After doing some research, I am starting to fear that my recent symptoms may be breast cancer, but I am wondering if that is possible, because I have had so many blood tests recently and all have come back normal. I have had intense, unrelenting breast itchiness (mostly on my right side) for months. Nothing has helped. No rash, no discernible cause. Then, two months ago, I suddenly started feeling very weak, extremely fatigued, short of breath when doing anything, dizzy, nauseous, losing my hair, forgetting everything, having trouble concentrating. Then, a few weeks ago, my right shoulder started aching. Then, very shortly afterwards, my lymph node in the same armpit started hurting on and off. I went to a specialist for the dizziness and they did an MRI... they found a small mass in my lymph node in my cheek (also on my right side). I have been referred to an oncologist, but have to wait for a month and a half. I find that unacceptable, as this is literally ruining my life, and has been going on for more than two months. After doing research about less common symptoms of breast cancer, I read about the itching, lymph node pain, and shoulder pain that could be signs of cancer, and I am worried that maybe it is cancer that has spread to my lymph nodes. I am wondering, does anyone know if this is possible without showing up on my routine bloodwork? Does anyone have any experience with this, or with these symptoms? Sorry for the long post... I am so worn out and looking for answers. Any information is greatly appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2017 10:23AM dearrainy wrote: djmammo: No. I really think they think I'm exaggerating my symptoms. I called and left a message for my doctor yesterday letting her know I was having real problems with dizziness and nausea and catching my breath, and of course, had a fever, and found another painful node under my other arm, and asked if she thought I should go back to the hospital or anything else. No return call at all. I'm pretty sure that whatever happens, I'm going to find a new doctor after this.

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2017 03:57PM dearrainy wrote: outfield: thank you for your post. that was my understanding, that it could start anywhere... but i am not a physician, obviously. i already know i have an enlarged lymph node in my face, and one in my armpit on the same side. and i thought yesterday i started feeling pains in the armpit on the other side, but thought maybe i was just psyching myself out. it is official, today that side hurts to touch too. so *something* is definitely going on with my lymph nodes. icietla: the doctor hasn't said. as far as i know, it's just iron deficiency anemia... we were too busy discussing other things. i am going to see my hematologist on friday and i am going to discuss it further with him. i did ask the doctor if it was possible to go from my previous numbers (iron deficiency) in july to anemia now from them taking blood for all of these tests, though, and he said it was not possible, even with being generous in how much blood they were taking. and i know there is no bleeding from the colonoscopy, so once again, *something* is going on. even if the hematologist can't figure anything out, at least maybe he can help with the anemia, which will no doubt help me feel a bit better.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2017 08:23AM - edited Aug 14, 2017 08:25AM by dearrainy update: i was able to get some strings pulled through my doctor's office and they are going to do my mammogram and an ultrasound of both armpits this afternoon. 2 1/2 more hours and then i can head over. thank god. i just came back from the store and i was so dizzy and nauseous i thought i was going to throw up. and i couldn't make it up the steps to my apartment without taking a break on the steps, and then one on the sidewalk afterwards. things are getting much worse. i hope this provides some answers. no matter what they are. i am ready. thank you all for your posts and encouragement. it really means a lot just to have people to talk to and that believe that something is happening to me, even if you can't give me the answers. you don't know how much i appreciate it.
Posts.Title: Would BC in lymph nodes show up in routine blood work? dearrainy dearrainy

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2017 06:09AM dearrainy wrote: so after all of that nonsense yesterday, i had to sit there for hours at the doctors and... nothing. not even a swollen lymph node. i don't understand. in the last week and a half, the doctors said they could feel them. and then they weren't there. i still have the pain in my shoulder that they said was from the lymph node... it isn't nearly as bad, but it's still there. i was fully prepared to accept bad news. more people telling me that there is nothing wrong with me was so hard to hear. i am starting to think that i really am crazy. i have appointments on thursday and friday with my neurologist and hematologist to see if it could be something in my brain or blood, but i suspect those will turn up nothing as well. so i guess my only option at this point is to really sit and wait for something else to happen, and then go back to the doctor again. not the best option, but at this point, i don't really know what else to do. i have had a lot of tests and they all come back negative, and i don't think my own doctor even believes me when i tell her that i can barely stand for 5 minutes or that i'm having a hard time catching my breath. anyway, i guess i don't really belong on here, since BC has been ruled out for sure. thank you all for the support and kind words. i truly appreciate it. take care.
